alert.note: Alert for McKinley (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 06 at 12:53PM MDT until July 06 at 4:15PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of west central New Mexico, including the following county, McKinley. * WHEN...Until 245 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1252 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms tracking towards the northeast. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 0.75 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Nakaibito, Tohatchi and Brimhall Nizhoni. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
